meanings.definition: A mark against a person for misconduct or deficiency.
meanings.sent1: Receiving demerits at school can lead to consequences.
meanings.sent2: One of the demerits of living in a big city is the noise.
meanings.sent3: The demerits on his record made him strive to improve his behavior.
meanings.sent4: The demerits on her report card weighed heavily on her mind.
meanings.sent5: The demerits served as a reminder to follow the rules.

meanings.sent1: The demerits of the plan became evident during the meeting.
meanings.sent2: One demerit of the new phone is its short battery life.
meanings.sent3: Despite its demerits, the old car held sentimental value.
meanings.sent4: The demerits of procrastination can impact your success.
meanings.sent5: She carefully weighed the demerits before making a decision.

meanings.definition: To deserve or incur a demerit.
meanings.sent1: He demerits a warning for breaking the rules.
meanings.sent2: If you don't follow the guidelines, you may demerit a penalty.
meanings.sent3: She demerits a demerit for arriving late to class.
meanings.sent4: The careless mistake will demerit him a demerit on his record.
meanings.sent5: Ignoring safety protocols can demerit serious consequences.
